content.description: Start on the left side of a low shelf. Move your way up to the lip, and then traverse right to finish up as for The Shaman.
content.location: It is slightly left of the middle of the overhung face.

content.description: Sit start just to the right of the low blunt arete on positive holds, the left arete of the overhanging side of Bubba Boulder. Traverse rightwards and upwards all the way across the lip of the overhang until you get to the right arete and top out over the largest part of the roof. Outstanding problem.
content.location: It ascends the overhanging side of Bubba Boulder.

content.description: Sit start under the roof with your hands matched on the right side of the low shelf. Go up to a left hand sidepull, and utilize hold(s) on the roof to power out to the lip. Finish with a technical mantel topout - the same as The Shaman.
content.location: This boulder sits on the trail. The problem climbs out of the cave/roof feature.

content.description: start with a match on a good, sloper jug rail and a high heel on the same rail. Dynamically move up, and grab a good chip with your left hand. Cross your hands, and move over to good pocket pinch with your left hand and a crimp with your right hand. Make a big move with your left hand into bad, 3 finger pocket and bring your right hand into a slopey crack. Finally, reach for the top on a good, juggy topout.
content.protection: 1-2 pads and maybe a spotter for the topout.
content.location: It is on the backside of Bubba Boulder just to the left of Jug Ladder.

content.description: This wonderful problem follows the obvious and plentiful jugs ascending the back side of Bubba Boulder. With an easy ascent, the "crux" is topping out as the holds are less then ideal although not terrible considering some other topouts at Rock House. Overall, this is a good problem especially for warming up or calling off holds and experimenting with different technique.
content.location: Follow the trail leading into the woods right of Turdle Boulder. The problem will be on the backside of the large boulder and should be easy to identify as the one with the large jugs.

content.description: Start sitting with your hands marched on a good sidepull. Move up the arete and left until you can turn the corner, and huck the same somewhat hard mantel of The Shaman and Power Animal.This is probably not a first ascent. If you have a different name or grade, let me know, and I’ll change it.
content.location: It is on the far right side of The Shaman face.

content.description: Frost Tiger is a bit contrived as it shares the start and end with Power Animal, but it has really great movement. Start sitting on the low shelf in the middle of the face as with Power Animal. Move up to the seam right below the roof and then right to the arete. Climb up the arete, turning the corner and pressing out a hard mantel.
content.location: Start on the obvious low shelf in the middle of the face.

content.description: Start with both of your hands underclinging the crack. There's a small dimple to put your left foot and right foot goes wherever feels comfortable. Then go left hand to some jagged quartz crystals below the hole. Use the jug on the right side of the hole to get the topout.
content.location: Follow the path to the right of "The Reach". There's a giant boulder with a hole in the top. There is a nice vb warm-up is on the other side and a tiny roof project is on the left side, but they are usually covered by bugs in the summer.

content.description: Start on positive crimps at about face height just right of the blunt arete. Move up to a sloper and a thin right hand gaston, then bump up to a slopey jug and top out.
content.location: It ascends the blunt arete on the left hand side of the steep face of the Bubba Boulder.

content.description: This boulder has some decent problems.
